articles.title: Ban on paying ransoms to cyber criminals to be brought in by the Government
articles.author: Charles Hymas
articles.summary: All public bodies using state money and providers of critical infrastructure will be banned from making ransom payments to cyber criminals. Government will take powers to block them from doing so if there is a risk that terrorist groups, sanctioned criminals or hostile states could benefit. Organisations that fail to tell the Government could face criminal or civil sanctions. Dan Jarvis, the security minister, said the aim is to prevent them inadvertently paying money over to banned groups.
